name: Dumbbell Bent Over Row
how_to_perform:
1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand and bend over at the waist, keeping your back straight and legs slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.

2. Lower your torso until it is almost parallel to the ground, maintaining control and keeping your elbows close to your body as you lift the dumbbells upwards.

3. Contract your lats and draw your shoulders towards your spine as you pull the dumbbells towards your chest, squeezing your back muscles at the top of the movement.

4. Hold this contracted position briefly before slowly returning the dumbbells to their starting position.

5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining control throughout the exercise.
short_summary: A rear-angled row exercise that primarily targets the lats and lower back using dumbbells.
